qas.question: What is the climate like in Southeast Asia?
Which region has the 2nd largest rain-forest in the world?
Which regions in Southeast Asia see cold winter with snow?

answers.text: Northern Vietnam and the Myanmar Himalayas

qas.question: What causes additional rainfall during monsoon?
What causes the Southeast Asian regions to experience wet & dry seasons?

answers.text: seasonal shift in winds or monsoon

qas.question: What part of Asia is mostly subtropical?
North Vietnam and what other region have atropical climate?
What region has the largest rain forest in the world?
What is the climate like in the souther mountain region?

context: The climate in <b5_0><b7_0>Southeast<b5_0/> Asia<b7_0/> is mainly <a0_0>tropical–hot and humid<a0_0/> all year round with plentiful rainfall. <a2_0>Northern Vietnam and the <b6_0>Myanmar Himalayas<b6_0/><a2_0/> are the only regions in Southeast Asia that feature a subtropical climate, which has a cold winter with snow. The majority of <a1_0>Southeast Asia<a1_0/> has a wet and dry season caused by <a4_0>seasonal shift in winds or monsoon<a4_0/>. <a3_0>The tropical rain belt<a3_0/> causes additional rainfall during the monsoon season. The rain forest is the second largest on earth (with the Amazon being the largest). An exception to this type of climate and vegetation is the mountain areas in the northern region, where high altitudes lead to <b8_0>milder temperatures and drier landscape<b8_0/>. Other parts fall out of this climate because they are desert like.
